meanings.definition: To withdraw from a commitment or agreement.
meanings.sent1: I had to backout of the party because I wasn't feeling well.
meanings.sent2: She decided to backout of the project at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: When the cat saw the dog approaching, it tried to backout of the room.
meanings.sent4: The student had to backout of the competition due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent5: The driver had to backout of the deal after discovering hidden fees.

meanings.definition: To reverse a vehicle out of a space.
meanings.sent1: The driver carefully backed out of the parking spot to avoid hitting other cars.
meanings.sent2: It can be tricky to backout of a tight parking space.
meanings.sent3: The robot car was programmed to backout smoothly without any collisions.
meanings.sent4: The truck had to backout of the narrow alley with precision.
meanings.sent5: The driver used the rearview mirror to help backout safely.

meanings.definition: A withdrawal from a commitment or agreement.
meanings.sent1: Her sudden backout from the deal surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The company's backout from the contract caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent3: The backout of the sponsor left the event organizers scrambling for a replacement.
meanings.sent4: The team had to deal with the consequences of the investor's backout.
meanings.sent5: The backout of the key player affected the team's performance.
